Package gameElements.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
gameElements.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
The Board class represents a 15x15 chess board on which GamePieces reside and the castles on either side
Author:
Pranav Gunhal, Richard Feng, Nishil Anand

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    Board()
    Constructs a new Board with width 15 and height 15

    Constructs a new Board with the specified width and height

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new Board with the specified width and height
      Parameters:
      x - The width of this board
      y - The height of this board

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new Board with width 15 and height 15

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(DrawingSurface surface, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws this board on a DrawingSurface PApplet
      Parameters:
      surface - The surface (PApplet) on which this board is to be drawn on
      x - The leftmost point of the board
      y - The topmost point of the board
      width - The width of the board
      height - The height of the board

    • getCoordFromIndex

      public Point2D.Float getCoordFromIndex(float x, float y, float width, float height, int r, int c)
      Returns the xy coordinates of a point given the index
      Parameters:
      x - The leftmost x value on the board
      y - The topmost y value on the board
      width - The width of the board
      height - The height of the board
      r - The row of the index
      c - The column of the index
      Returns:
      The coordinate at the given index on this board

    • get

      public GamePiece get(int x, int y)
      Returns the GamePiece at a certain location
      Parameters:
      x - The row of the GamePiece
      y - The column of the GamePiece
      Returns:
      the GamePiece at board[x][y], if it is valid

    • set

      public void set(GamePiece l, int x, int y)
      Adds a GamePiece to an index on this board
      Parameters:
      l - The GamePiece to be added
      x - The row where l is to be added
      y - The column where l is to be added
      Postcondition:
      If board[x][y] is valid, it will be set to l

    • add

      public void add(GamePiece piece)
      Adds a GamePiece piece to this Board using piece's Location
      Parameters:
      piece - GamePiece to add to the board
      Precondition:
      piece must not be null. piece must also have properly a initialized Location loc which is in the board

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the height of this board
      Returns:
      the height of this board

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the width of this board
      Returns:
      the width of this board

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds(int r, int c)
      Determines whether a certain index is within the bounds of this board
      Parameters:
      r - The row which is being tested
      c - The column which is being tested
      Returns:
      True if board[r][c] is a valid index, False otherwise

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(int r, int c)
      Determines whether the Board is empty at a certain Location
      Parameters:
      r - The row which is being tested
      c - The column which is being tested
      Returns:
      True if board[i][c] is null, False otherwise.

    • clickToIndex

      public Point clickToIndex(Point p, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Determines the index of the grid which matches with a particular pixel coordinate. This supports interaction with the grid using mouse clicks in the window. Example usage (given board is a Board and surface is a DrawingSurface: Point loc = board.clickToIndex(surface.actualCoordinatesToAssumed(new Point(surface.mouseX, surface.mouseY)), boardX, boardY, boardWidth, boardHeight);
      Parameters:
      p - A Point object containing a graphical pixel coordinate.
      x - The x pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
      y - The y pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
      width - The pixel width of the grid drawing.
      height - The pixel height of the grid drawing.
      Returns:
      A Point object representing a coordinate within the grid (x, y) (column, row).

    • play

      public void play()
      Plays the game according to GamePiece behavior
      Postcondition:
      the Locations and health of some or all GamePieces may be affected

    • getKingHealth

      public int getKingHealth(boolean white)
      Returns the health of the king of a certain side.
      Parameters:
      white - Whether the king is on the white side or not
      Returns:
      The health of the corresponding king

    • damageKing

      public void damageKing(int dmg, boolean white)
      Damages the king. If the king dies, prints that the game has ended and updates gameInProgress.
      Parameters:
      dmg - how much damage to inflict
      white - true to damage white king, false to damage black king

    • remove

      public void remove(int r, int c)
      Removes a GamePiece from the specified location
      Parameters:
      r - The row of the GamePiece to be removed
      c - The column of the GamePiece to be removed
      Postcondition:
      board[r][c] is null

    • checkGameOver

      public int checkGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over by king health being is less than or equal to 0.
      Returns:
      0 if the game is not over, 1 if white won, 2 if black won, 3 if draw (both kings die at same time)

    • listToArray

      public void listToArray(ArrayList<ArrayList<GamePiece>> list)
      Converts a 2D ArrayList of GamePieces into GamePieces on this Board
      Parameters:
      list - The 2D ArrayList of GamePieces
      Postcondition:
      this Board is a 2D array representation of list

    • removeArray

      public void removeArray()
      Makes this board null so its safe to post
      Postcondition:
      this Board is completely null

    • getBoard

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<GamePiece>> getBoard()
      Converts this Board into a 2D ArrayList of GamePieces
      Returns:
      a 2D ArrayList containing GamePieces as this Board does
